definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Scientists study Lake Baikal to better understand evolutionary science.
sentences.chinese: 科学家研究贝加尔湖，以更好地了解进化科学。

sentences.english: This trip to the Baikal was made by several Russian men in March of this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年三月份，一群俄罗斯人步上了贝加尔湖之旅。

sentences.english: Baikal is the most beautiful place in the world.
sentences.chinese: 贝加尔湖震撼人心，是世界上最深最清的湖。

sentences.english: It's in the summer months that you'll find Baikal's most famous residents - the Baikal seals.
sentences.chinese: 贝加尔湖数量最多的居民就是贝加尔海豹。

sentences.english: North of these mountains lies Siberia-and Lake Baikal.
sentences.chinese: 西伯利亚和贝加尔湖就位于这些山岭的北方。

sentences.english: In summer the stream from the gully flows into the Baikal.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，溪水从山谷流进贝加尔湖。

sentences.english: Svyatoy Point in Russia's Lake Baikal.
sentences.chinese: 圣点在俄罗斯的贝加尔湖。

sentences.english: A city of south-central Russia near the southern end of Lake Baikal.
sentences.chinese: 伊尔库次克俄国中南部城市，靠近贝加尔湖的南端。

definition: Irtysh River, flowing from southwest Altai in Xinjiang through Kazakhstan and Siberia to the Arctic Ocean
Argun River of Mongolia and Heilongjiang province, tributary of Heilongjiang River 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
Altai mountain range in Xinjiang and Siberia
Altai mountain chain on the border of Russia and Mongolia

pinyin: Hu1 lun2 bei4 er3 cao3 yuan2
